_prev_prog_3.Description:
Plant 27 Raw Materials Receiving, Storage, and Distribution



Includes storage of acetaldehyde used at Plant 27 and anhydrous ammonia used at Plant 27 and Plant 41.

Plant 27 Reactor/Regenerator Process

Includes Plant 27 reaction processes as well as the ammonia regenerator.
Hydrogen Storage (Air Products and Chemicals, Inc.)

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RMP EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



Vertellus Agriculture and Nutrition Specialties LLC (Vertellus), located in Indianapolis, Indiana, is a specialty chemical manufacturing company.  This facility was formerly owned by Reilly Industries, Inc. and previous RMP submissions are under the Reilly Industries, Inc. name as well as the Vertellus name.  Vertellus is committed to the protection of the environment and to the safety and health of its employees and communities.  This commitment incorporates the safe and environmentally sound development, manufacture, distribution, use and disposal of its products.  In addition, as a member of the American Chemistry Council, Vertellus has pledged commitment to the Responsible CareA® Program.  The Guiding Principles of Responsible Care require Vertellus to make continuous progress towards the vision of no accidents, injuries or harm to the environment.  Responsible Care has six codes of Management Practice, two of which are particularly relevant to RMP.



The Community Awareness and Emergency Response (CAER) Code addresses community outreach and emergency response.  The goal of the CAER Code is to assure emergency preparedness and to foster community right-to-know.  As a result of the CAER Code, Vertellus meets quarterly with the surrounding neighborhood to keep the neighbors informed on Vertellus activities and to discuss any concerns the community may have.  



The Process Safety Code addresses process safety and, at a minimum, incorporates OSHA's process safety management system regulation.  Vertellus has been in full practice with all codes of Responsible Care since the end of 1997.



The RMP chemicals handled at this plant include acetaldehyde, anhydrous ammonia, piperidine, chlorine, and hydrogen.  Vertellus uses an aqueous formaldehyde (52%) and methanol solution in multiple processes throughout the facility that was reported on previous RMP submissions.  Though the formaldehyde solution was included in two initial RMP submissi

ons for the facility, upon further review the determination was made that the mixture does not qualify for inclusion based on the vapor pressure of the solution [40 CFR 68.115(b)(1)].



This Executive Summary includes a brief description of the overall Accident Prevention Program, Five Year Accident History, and the Emergency Response Program.  Finally, the summary includes a brief overview of safety improvement projects.



Accident Prevention Program

The Vertellus accident prevention program is based on both OSHA's Process Safety Management regulation and the Responsible Care Process Safety Code.  Vertellus has developed a process safety system for all processes at the plant, including non-RMP and non-OSHA processes.



Five Year Accident History

Vertellus had one accidental releases of covered substances over the past five (5) years that meet the RMP reporting requirements. An RMP reportable accidental release from a covered process is one which results in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on-site, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage (40 CFR 68.42).   



Emergency Response Program

The Vertellus emergency response program includes an emergency response plan that was prepared in accordance with OSHA and EPA (RCRA) requirements.  The plan is coordinated with the Local Emergency Planning Committee.  The program includes bringing the Indianapolis Fire Department on-site annually for joint training and inspections.  In addition, Vertellus has a telephone notification system that, in the event of an emergency, would communicate to the neighbors the appropriate protective actions to take.



Safety Improvement Projects

Vertellus has implemented a number of projects that demonstrate its commitment to overall safety.  Since the original filing of the RMP, chemical detection systems have been installed in certain process areas.  Security cameras to monitor rail lines, tanks and pr

ocess areas have been placed in primary production areas.  Fall protection platforms for rail and tank access have been installed.  Vertellus will continue to review all offsite consequence analyses and initiate appropriate changes to mitigate uncovered impacts.
